text.text_translated:
Gary Collins is a policeman.  
He was off duty and watched the London riots on TV.  
He recognized several people on the screen.  
He stopped his holiday early to help with identification.  
He spent six months looking at CCTV video and he managed to identify 190 people.  
He identified many of them just by their eyes.  
His help was of decisive importance in the investigation.  
The police recorded about 200,000 hours of video.  
Facial recognition software found only one person.
